review: Okay, so I got this thing to watch Netflix on because I don't have a smart TV. I was able to watch one single movie half way thru. Now it just tells me it cant access the movie, try again later or another title. Well, absolutely nothing will play on it. I followed all of the directions, reset everything and it still gives me the same message. It has even been updated and still will play a movie. So, ZERO STARS. do not waste your money.

review: i love it but this signal from the remote to the device was weak.  we would have to press the button repeatedly to get it to respond.  eventually we placed a mirror angle behind the tv and device and it solved all of our problems with the remove to device communication.  amazon should work and solving this issue.  also the device uses up a small amount of bandwidth even when not in use so if your watching your internet usage make sure you turn it off or unplug when not in use!
author: Martin Bing

review: I purchase the Fire TV Stick to "cut the cable", which has in whole been a success. It was a snap to install and the set up was simple, since I already had an Amazon Prime account and a Netflex account.You can subscribe to other perks as well if you would like. I truly watch most of my programs through HULU, Netflex and Amazon Prime.A few things I feel could be better is the wifi connection and speed. It seems to drop sometimes, which causes a pause in the movie but its nothing I would ditch the program for, because I'm saving money so a little inconvenience is okay for me. You?? Only you have the answer for that question. The other thing is it does take a bit of navigating to find the programs you would like to watch. I wish they had more " add to my lists" available. Allowing you to place movies and programs that are age friendly and FREE for the children to browse, And then my list or lists.Overall I like the system and I would purchase it again in a heart beat.
